cymodocea rotundata extracts exhibited predominant growth inhibitory activity against uti bacteria and human pathogens.
cymodocea rotundata extracts gave a total antioxidant activity of 6.65 mg ascorbic acid equivalent/g and was found to be a potent dpph radical scavenger (70.
cymodocea rotundata has a wide indopacific distribution and is relatively common within its range.
cymodocea rotundata is a widespread seagrass that occurs in shallow water, on sand-mud in sheltered coves or bays, lagoons, mouth of rivers and coral reefs throughout the philippines.

fractions with spots of the same rf values were combined and rechromatographed in appropriate solvent systems until tlc pure isolates were obtained.
general isolation procedure a glass column 6 inches in height and 0.25 inch internal diameter was used for the chromatography.
isolation of the chemical constituents from the leaves of cymodocea rotundata the air-dried cymodocea rotundata (50 g) leaves were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for 3 days and then filtered.

pharmacogn j. 2018; 10:620-621 a multifaceted journal in the field of natural products and pharmacognosy www.phcogj.com | www.journalonweb.com/pj | www.phcog.net original article 620 pharmacognosy journal, vol 10, issue 4, jul-aug, 2018.
phytochemical analysis of cymodocea rotundata extracts indicated the presence of tannins, saponins, resins, proteins, acidic compounds, reducing sugars, terpenoids, cardiac glycosides and alkaloids.

results: this study has led to the isolation of beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters , chlorophyll a and a mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 1:1 ratio from the dichloromethane extract of cymodocea rotundata. .: this is the first report on the isolation of 1-3b from cymodocea rotundata.
sample collection samples of the leaves of cymodocea rotundata asch and schweinf were collected from the seagrass meadow of caramoan, camarines sur philippines in september 2016.

silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract of cymodocea rotundata has led to the isolation of beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters , chlorophyll a and a mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol .
the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using 10% etoac in petroleum ether.

the 60% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed using ch3cn:et2o:ch2cl2 (1:1:8, v/v) to afford beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, (3 mg) after washing with petroleum ether..
the crude extracts were fractionated by silica gel chromatography using increasing proportions of acetone in ch2cl2 at 10% increment by volume as eluents.
the less polar fractions were combined and rechromatographed using 10% etoac in petroleum ether to afford chlorophyll a, (4 mg) after washing with petroleum ether, followed by et2o.

the more polar fractions were combined and rechromatographed chlorophyll a, ) using 15% etoac in petroleum ether to yield a mixture of beta-sitosterol, and stigmasterol, (6 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.

the nmr data of beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters, are in accordance with the data reported in the literature for beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-o-fatty acid esters;8 chlorophyll a, for chlorophyll a9 beta-sitosterol, for beta-sitosterol;10,11 and stigmasterol, for stigmasterol.
the samples were authenticated at the botany division, philippine national museum.

this is the first report on the isolation of 1-3b from cymodocea rotundata.
this study is part of our research on the chemical constituents of seagrasses found in the philippines.
to the best of our knowledge, this is the first report on the isolation of 1-3b from cymodocea rotundata.

we earlier reported the isolation of bis(2-ethylhexyl) phthalate, chlorophyll a, beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol from cymodocea serrulata.
we report herein the isolation of beta-sitosteryl-3beta-glucopyranoside-6'-ofatty acid esters , chlorophyll a and a mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol from cymodocea rotundata.
